Articles.Content: HOLD ON!... k, cool... Since there's Kerbal stats and they may modify the craft some how. What about a sandwich container for a boost in Kerbal modifiers. You run out, oh well, just 5% less boost?

So, like a buff to XP gain? An engineer gets X experience doing Y task, but if he eats a sandwich first, he gains X+Z experience from Y task.

Am I close?

this idea could go even further, you might have a whole variety of different snacks giving temporary buffs to various skill sets, if you wanted. the only problem is that i don't think anyone has ever seen what kerbals eat.
I'm not sure how it would work well in this game; i mean, what would a kerbal do, first of all, that would require modifiers?

Jeb's been holding it since 0.19 Can he has space-toilet?

-0.006 mass.
This suggestion for the game's development has been moved to Suggestions and Development.

Is it ok to not like this idea as a permanent feature? Ok, I do not like it. Seems like flowers for algernon. When the snack wears off the kerbal become a complete idiot.

It might make a nice mod though. Still, I would not use it.
sure, and give them tetris while in timewarp...
